title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for correctly describing one difference.

Two points for correctly describing two differences.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe one of the following differences between the methods of potato production shown in Image 1 and Image 2:
The response correctly describes one of the following differences between the methods of potato production shown in Image 1 and Image 2:
The response correctly describes two of the following differences between the methods of potato production shown in Image 1 and Image 2:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that the potato spread through relocation diffusion.

Two points for explaining how the potato spread through relocation diffusion, with reference to the spatial pattern of this diffusion.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following processes by which the potato diffused from its hearth of domestication to other continents:
The response correctly explains one of the following processes by which the potato diffused from its hearth of domestication to other continents:
The response correctly explains one of the following processes by which the potato diffused from its hearth of domestication to other continents:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating an environmental effect.

Two points for explaining the process by which an environmental effect is likely to occur.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways that the agricultural practice shown in Image 2 may affect local environmental sustainability:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that the agricultural practice shown in Image 2 may affect local environmental sustainability:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that the agricultural practice shown in Image 2 may affect local environmental sustainability:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating an effect of monocropping that may lead to local food insecurity.

Two points for explaining the process by which an effect of monocropping may lead to local food insecurity.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following degrees to which the practice of monocropping may lead to local food insecurity:
The response correctly explains one of the following degrees to which the practice of monocropping may lead to local food insecurity:
The response correctly explains one of the following degrees to which the practice of monocropping may lead to local food insecurity:

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that potatoes are easy to farm, store, and/or sell.

Two points for explaining why potatoes may be suitable for small-scale farmers to sell as a cash crop, transitioning out of subsistence farming.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways that potato farming may help small family farms in developing countries transition out of subsistence farming:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that potato farming may help small family farms in developing countries transition out of subsistence farming:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that potato farming may help small family farms in developing countries transition out of subsistence farming:
